TaskPriorityChangeEvent.summary: The TaskPriorityChangeEvent is the interface for the prioritychange event.

TaskPriorityChangeEventPreviousPriority.summary: The previousPriority read-only property of the interface returns the priority of the corresponding before it was changed and this prioritychange event was emitted.

remarks.para: This is the value that was set in the TaskPriorityChangeEvent constructor argument options.previous. <!-- link? -->
The new priority of the task can be read from event.target.priority.

TaskPriorityChangeEventPreviousPriority.value:
A string, indicating the associated task's priority before it was changed.
This will be one of: "user-blocking", "user-visible", "background".

TaskPriorityChangeEventTaskPriorityChang.summary: The TaskPriorityChangeEvent() constructor creates a new object.

remarks.para: This object is created with a value indicating the previous priority of the task: the priority before it changed and this event was fired.
